sphere that is less dense than water but does not float, then we have to give
up the principle that a sphere floats if it is less dense than water. (This is an
application of the sufficient condition test, discussed in Chapter 9.)
These methods help us rule out certain scientific principles, but the fact
that a principle implies true predictions does not, by itself, prove that the
principle is true. That argument woul
